title: As a jungler, if i give you my buff
body: As a jungler, if i give you my buff and right after you try to take any of my other camps I will automatically assume you are the dross of humanity. I don't care how well you are doing, or how nice in chat you have been, you are on my blacklist and there is no redemption. I curse you to forever be the floatsam that is slowly rotted away by the world. I don't care what role you are. Leave. Me. My. Camps.

replies.body:
As a jungler, I agree, ... during laning phase

However my personal M.O. is, when everyone is well into team-fight phase, no form of gold/exp has ownership. 

HOWEVER, resources should still go to those who gain the most benefit from them based on priority and proximity. The carries (Usually Bottom and Mid) need the most gold and exp so they generally take priority of minion waves (when a support has Spoils of War charges they should actually have priority for the use of those charges). Junglers still maintain the most benefit from jungle camps because they get the most experience and sustain from them. If your jungler is on the bottom side of the map and you see a minor camp is up on your way to shove out top side, .. by all means, take it.

Laners so often "claim" any and all lane minions, regardless of the time of the game. A tank might not need as much gold (and bruiser items cost more so??), but they still need those exp and gold incomes if they want to stay relevant. You can't ignore that even after laning phase. Also im talking more about me interacting with the camp and they steal it, not any camps across the map.

> [{quoted}](name=Potato Doc,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=9b5g5AEl,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-08-29T21:53:02.930+0000)
>
> Laners so often "claim" any and all lane minions, regardless of the time of the game. 

Well, they're wrong lol

I made sure to say "priority and PROXIMITY" 

When carriers and tanks/bruisers are close enough to question priority, they are usually pressuring objectives. Priority should go to the carry because they generally have better wave clear and gain the most benefit from gold. 

Otherwise, if the tank is the only champion in range to get a wave, they take it. This is actually an advantage of split pushing. Your team is more effectively dividing resources and applying pressure.

> [{quoted}](name=Potato Doc,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=9b5g5AEl,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-08-29T21:53:02.930+0000)
>
> Laners so often "claim" any and all lane minions, regardless of the time of the game. A tank might not need as much gold (and bruiser items cost more so??), but they still need those exp and gold incomes if they want to stay relevant. You can't ignore that even after laning phase. Also im talking more about me interacting with the camp and they steal it, not any camps across the map.

This is probably because, generally speaking, laners carry the jg.

I've seen Faker given countless camps, and then in soloq we get jgs like you who get mad if I steal 2 small wraiths to save 30 seconds for my largest powerspike.

You just say me jg my camps me. Do you care to know what the trade would be if you gave the camp away? No? Oh ok.

The best part is when I steal 2 wraiths and the jg complans, and acts like they didn't hover mid 1/3 the game and passive leech my xp, I don't even get a choice in the gold/experience you steal from me? LOL. Jgs that want to win don't cry about camps nearly as often. You also think you're justified to tell me to fuck off and that it's your camp, when there are a lot of jg that try to shove their camps down my throat they want to share so bad, so really, nothing is special about you taking the camp unless you 1v9. If you selfishly horde your camps and lose, maybe consider 'teamwork'.

I've played jg in diamond elo and hit 30 assists before 15 farm with pantheon, _but you need your camps._

90% of the role is ganking, not farming. Jg is a proxy damage support. You should be dying at opportunity to give away camps. Normally just giving my scuttles to mid laner alone causes a 3 level advantage, instead of the natural 2 level advantage. "Funneling" has been meta for whole seasons and you think sharing a camp is a bad strategy? LOL. This is a message to every jg that thinks all the camps are theirs. Not just you. One of the single greatest strength cheese first bloods I've ever got consistently is giving ADC red. It started naturally by accident, but then I saw if I just gave winning matchups red, they won even faster. Combine with a gank, the enemy normally never assumes is coming when the ADC has red, you pretty much can force entire lane decisions with single camp donations. JG passive(On your jg tool) that gives you bonus xp for being lower level, is almost designed this way for helping catch up after donating camps.


Edit: you literally only play carry on hit jgs tho, so, it's not like you probably even know how much power laners even can get, while minimizing your losses. your roster speaks for itself that you're terrible at that. The best way to play jg is as a support, and you prioritize it as a carry position, and now you're bitching about farm, (how predictable right :P).

Right gold 5 played in diamond and got 30 assists before 15 farm XD you funny bro 

Any good jungler would abuse the fact you weren't farming by invading and preventing you from leveling

Nice shitpost
It is a trap I'm telling you. When the ad asks "Can I take red" they actually mean redside jungle, not red buff
All that work a jungler puts into securing their four buffs and the adc still wants to reap the benefits of our work.
{{sticker:sg-miss-fortune}}
Ya I absolutely hate when they take my camps right after I give them a buff, but in some circumstances I also understand.

gold should always go to the person that needs it most.

if you are behind, its reasonable to get pissed at people who take your jungle camps.

but if your adc is lacking gold and you have great gold income at the moment, its good to give them the camp, you won't have to go down and clear it, which gives you the most ganking opportunity and helps your other lanes get ahead.

and i'm speaking, as a season 4-8 jungle main.

I do see your point, but the current state of the game favors champions that are already ahead over champions who are catching up. 

I am all for letting my ADC catch up by taking my camps while I am not in a good position to take them myself, especially when that allows me to apply pressure somewhere else, ... but if I'm nearby, behind, or if that camp is along my path, ... The jungler has more efficiency through experience and sustain from clearing camps. A laner is going to get full gold, but during the laning phase they are going to take a lot of damage, and will not gain as much exp as they would just going to farm minions.

Okay you didn't understand, im talking I just handed them a buff and go to farm only to have them steal it from me...

also

Season 1 jungler vs season 4 jungler

Silver 5 vs Diamond 5 jungler.

You tried to pull the seniority card first. So im doing it here too.

I have a game where I was giving my blue buffs to a lux because they were playing better than than me that game, little ways down the road (late game)  I walked through mid and gave them ~20 minions of farm, and went to do my jungle. The lux then took my wolves and still took blue buff. When I asked why and questioned them they pinged their item that they needed 20 gold for as if I didn't need the gold for items either. Was okay with it since they played really well but still.

If I have a relic shield proc up, and you last hit a cannon minion.
I swear to god im going to find your children irl
The betrayal is too real

My dear jungler, if you take gromp, give me blue (thanks!) and head up toplane I am killing your wolves. They will be back by the time you would come to gather them! Also if you are a single target jungle and are there doing your birds you have NO need to waste your smite on the big one if I drop an aoe while passing by. It's in my best interest that you farm fast and I'm actually helping you not trying to steal!
I'm kind enough to ask, "PLEASE GIVE ME THAT WOLF FOR LUDENS"

Just take lane gold tbh
Who cares
pretty much how i feel when you think scuttle is a reasonable call during my first wave, and think me sacrificing 2300 gold in early game stats for you to secure it is a good idea.

> [{quoted}](name=DANK KAT MEMES,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=9b5g5AEl,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-08-29T20:43:00.415+0000)
>
> pretty much how i feel when you think scuttle is a reasonable call during my first wave, and think me sacrificing 2300 gold in early game stats for you to secure it is a good idea.

Holy shit yeah. Like, Lee Sin, I get that you just landed a Q on their jungler. But this is a cannon wave and I am Sion. You don't HAVE to fight, then tilt that I didn't come before my lane opponent when clearly it was a bad call to begin with.
It's not *your* camps, it's *our* camps.
